results.title: Enthronement of the Archbishop of York
results.brief_description: Some of the recordings made at the enthronement of Archbishop Coggan in York Minster from the arrival of the Archbishop through to his installation and enthronement. Some explanation of cathedral traditions is given in the commentary.

results.title: Enterprise in Nigeria
results.creator_credit: Sydney Latter, Gerard Holdsworth and Unilever Films
results.brief_description: Nigeria, formerly an agricultural country, has a growing range of new industries giving Africans new opportunities and training facilities. With independence the process of industrialisation has accelerated. Shows how the United Africa Company, contributing capital and techniques in many different fields, is playing a part in the rapid development of the country. Traces the growth of industry in all three regions of Nigeria.

results.title: Enterprise
results.brief_description: The film which is in the form of a cartoon in technicolour shows how, at all times and in all ages, industry and commerce have derived their strength from calculated risk taken by shrewd, farsighted and courageous individuals. It begins with a fable about a potter of ancient Egypt whose one-man concern was faded with ruin until it was rescued by the enterprise of its owner. It then advances to the present day when great undertakings are characteristic of the industrial scene. The film shows something of the condition, national and international that brought I.C.I. into being and portrays the structure of the Company from board room to workshop floor.

results.title: Enquiry: K K K = Enquiry: Ku Klux Klan
results.creator_credit: David Dimbleby, David Webster and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: A report from the southern states of USA on the notorious Ku-Klux Klan society founded after the Civil War to maintain white protestant supremacy. Shows Tuscaloosa in Alabama, one of the main centres of activity, and interviews Robert Sheldon, Imperial Wizard of the Klan, and Charles Morgan, a Birmingham lawyer, who regards the organisation as a collection of murderers. Collie Leroy Wilkinson, acquitted of the murder of the Civil Rights worker Mrs Violet Liuzzo, is introduced at a meeting as a hero. Includes 1921 and 1925 archival footage.

results.title: An Englishman's horse
results.creator_credit: David Cammell, Jean Wadlow and Charles Barker Films
results.brief_description: The ancient partnership of man with horse is celebrated in this film. Two horse trials are featured showing something of just how tough a horse trial can be. Originally a form of cavalry training, it is the ultimate test of horse and rider.

results.title: An English village
results.brief_description: Harting, a pleasant village in the south of England, follows the traditional pattern of an English village as a neighbourly community in which people live, work, and enjoy their leisure together. In particular, the film illustrates the many communal activities, such as the Parish Council and the Women’s Institute, which play an important part in English village life.

results.title: English teaching tomorrow (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Discusses the problem of teaching english to resistant pupils who constantly use non-standard english. A teacher and an elementary school principal ask advice of linguists to help provide varying approaches to the problem.

results.title: The English language: story of its development
results.brief_description: Traces the history of the English language from its roots in the Anglo and Saxon tongues, through its infusion of French and Latin, and finally its emergence as a printed language which is still growing and changing. The influence of Church monks, William the Conqueror, Chaucer and Shakespeare are discussed.
